alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 6:30PM CDT until June 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL HOCKLEY AND SOUTHEASTERN LAMB COUNTIES... At 630 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding due to heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 6 inches of rain have fallen northwest of Anton between Whitharral and Spade, and water has been reported over several roadways in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Anton, Whitharral and Spade. While rainfall has ended, flash flooding is expected to continue in the warned area. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
